description: Relief shown pictorially. Central map flanked by 10 views of cities and towns on each side, printed on 3 strips of paper. Publisher information on separate sheets, pasted over the original de Wit imprint which was printed on the same strip as the lowest town views. Title also printed separately. 9 leaves of text below central map. Beneath title:  I. Ottens excudit cum privilegie ordinum Hollandiae et Westfrisiae. Text "Nova Africae descriptio" published by Frederik de Wit. The text and the views both appear in his original edition of the map, published around 1700. Includes map of Northern Hemisphere, longitude diagram, and illustrations. Shows California as an island. Views in left margin: Mexico -- Mauritiopolis [view] -- Mauritiopolis [map] -- Nieuw Amsterdam -- Nombre D Dios -- La Vera Crvs -- Trugillo -- Hauana Portus -- Cartagena -- Callao de Lima. Views in right margin: San Salvador -- Bvones Aires -- Capvt S. Avgustini -- Boa Vista -- Panama - S. Marta -- Campetie -- S. Domingo -- Porto Rico -- Portu Acapvulco. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. French. Dutch and Spanish publisher information. Latin text.

created_published: Gedrukt tot Amsterdam : By R. & J. Ottens, op den Nieuwen Dyk in de werelt kaart, [1730?]

Beneath title:  I. Ottens excudit cum privilegie ordinum Hollandiae et Westfrisiae.

Shows California as an island.

Views in right margin: San Salvador -- Bvones Aires -- Capvt S. Avgustini -- Boa Vista -- Panama - S. Marta -- Campetie -- S. Domingo -- Porto Rico -- Portu Acapvulco.

description: Relief shown pictorially. Includes map of the world in two hemispheres, 2 diagrams, text, and illustrations. Title strip printed separately from map. Text in right, left and bottom margins by Nicolaes Visscher. Printed separately from map. Illustrations of local residents/costumes in left margin: Angli et Hyberni -- Galli -- Belgi -- Norvegi -- Litvani -- Poloni -- Bohemi -- Germani. Illustrations of local residents/costumes in right margin: Potvgalli -- Cantabri -- Castiliani -- Tvscani -- Venetiani -- Graeci -- Hvngari -- Helvetii. Views on bottom margin: London -- Paris -- Lisbona -- Toledo -- Roma -- Veneti[a] -- Amsterdam -- Nvrenberg -- Praga -- Vilna -- Muscovia -- Constantinopoli. Geography and Maps, an illustrated guide, page 40 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Gift; Hans P. Kraus. Latin. Text in Latin, Dutch, and French.
